      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static CreditCardView copyFrom(CreditCardView card)
      Creates a CreditCardView with the same attributes as the passed one This will only copy all the colors and style's relative stuff
      boolean errorsEnabled()
      Returns whether error logging is enabled or not (This errors are not meant for debugging but to show the users errors when they type incorrect data), errors can be checked using the listener
      void flip()
      Flips the card, using a smooth animation and from right to left
      void flip(boolean flipped)
      Flips the card based on the passed value, using a smooth animation and from right to left
      void flip(boolean flipped, boolean smoothFlip)
      Flips the card based on the passed value, from right to left
      void flip(boolean flipped, boolean smoothFlip, boolean leftToRight)
      Flips the card based based on the passed values
      private void flipWithoutAnimation(boolean flipped, boolean leftToRight)
      Flips the card without using any animation, it just sets the flipped state to the views This should only be used for the preview in Android Studio
      protected java.lang.String formatCardNumber(java.lang.String string)
      Formats the card number based on the values of numberVisibility,hideChar,groupSize and the length of the card number
      protected java.lang.String formatCVV(java.lang.String string)
      Formats the CVV based on the values of cvvVisibility and hideChar
      protected java.lang.String formatExpiry(java.lang.String string)
      Formats the expiry so it matches the format MM/YY

      Pairs the given TextView with the specified card's component Whenever the passed TextView content will be edited, it will be written in the specified card's component This will save time and make you write less boilerplate code

        private android.graphics.drawable.Drawable getCardBackgroundResource(android.content.res.TypedArray array,
                                                                     int index,
                                                                     int defaultValue)

        Parameters:
        array - TypedArray
        index - Index of the resource (from attrs.xml)
        defaultValue - Default value, must be a color reference (E.g. R.color.red) and not a raw color (#ff0000)

        Formatted string

      • errorsEnabled

        public boolean errorsEnabled()
        Returns whether error logging is enabled or not (This errors are not meant for debugging but to show the users errors when they type incorrect data), errors can be checked using the listener
        Returns:
        True if error logging is enabled, False otherwise

        public void setErrorsEnabled(boolean errorsEnabled)
        Enables/Disables error logging
        Parameters:
        errorsEnabled - True to enable error loggins, False otherwise

      • hideAllErrors

        public void hideAllErrors()
        Hides all errors and their TextViews, this should be called instead of calling and passing null to the error method

      • setFlipOnCVVEdit

        public void setFlipOnCVVEdit(boolean flipOnCVVEdit)
        Enables/Disable flip when the CVV is being edited. If the card is not flipped and the CVV is being edited, the card will flip back
        Parameters:
        flipOnCVVEdit - True to enable, False otherwise

      • setFlipOnFrontDataEdit

        public void setFlipOnFrontDataEdit(boolean flipOnFrontDataEdit)
        Enables/Disables flip when any of the front TextView is being edited. If the card is flipped and any of the front TextView is being edited, the card will flip to the front side
        Parameters:
        flipOnFrontDataEdit - True to enable, False otherwise

      • isFlipped

        public boolean isFlipped()
        Returns whether the card is flipped or not
        Returns:
        True if it is flipped, False otherwise

      • flip

        public void flip()
        Flips the card, using a smooth animation and from right to left

      • flip

        public void flip(boolean flipped)
        Flips the card based on the passed value, using a smooth animation and from right to left
        Parameters:
        flipped - True if the back must be shown, False otherwise

      • flip

        public void flip(boolean flipped,
                 boolean smoothFlip)
        Flips the card based on the passed value, from right to left
        Parameters:
        flipped - True if the back must be shown, False otherwise
        smoothFlip - True if the animation must be shown, False otherwise

      • flip

        public void flip(boolean flipped,
                 boolean smoothFlip,
                 boolean leftToRight)
        Flips the card based based on the passed values
        Parameters:
        flipped - True if the back must be shown, False otherwise
        smoothFlip - True if the animation must be shown, False otherwise
        leftToRight - True if the animation must start from left and go to right, False otherwise

      • flipWithoutAnimation

        private void flipWithoutAnimation(boolean flipped,
                                  boolean leftToRight)
        Flips the card without using any animation, it just sets the flipped state to the views This should only be used for the preview in Android Studio
        Parameters:
        flipped - True if the back must be shown, False otherwise

      • pairInputText

        public void pairInputText(android.widget.TextView inputView,
                          CreditCardView.InputType inputType)
        Pairs the given TextView with the specified card's component Whenever the passed TextView content will be edited, it will be written in the specified card's component This will save time and make you write less boilerplate code
        Parameters:
        inputView - Input TextView (can be any of the TextView's children, for instance an EditText or a TextInputEditText)
        inputType - Must be one of CreditCardView.InputType
